comments:
0129

1. Unzip eclipse into c:\eclipse0129
2. Launch eclipse - this should work fine. (I usually create a shortcut and 
launch from there, but you can use the command line)
3. exit 
4. Rename the directory from eclipse0129 to eclipsex0129.
5. Launch eclipse (you need to create a new shortcut because the directory name 
is now different. if you use the command line you can use the same one)
The splash screen comes up and then down almost immediately.  A message is 
written, but it disappears.

The problem appears to be absolute paths in the install directory - if I 
discard the files immediately in the install directory, eclipse works as 
expected again.

I realize this is being replaced in the 2.0 update solution.  It would be good 
if we avoided this particular failure case.

Stack trace contents follow
C:\eclipsex0129\eclipse>c:\jdk1.4\bin\java -cp startup.jar org.eclipse.core.laun
cher.UIMain
Exception launching the Eclipse Platform UI:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.
java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAcces
sorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:151)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:502)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.UIMain.main(UIMain.java:52)
Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.
java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAcces
sorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBoo
tLoader.java:996)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoa
der.java:883)
        at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:321)
        ... 7 more
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.activateDefaultPlu
gins(InternalPlatform.java:112)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderStartup(Inte
rnalPlatform.java:594)
        ... 14 more

This one is in fact introduced by the 2.0 code that is now in core boot. The 
platform.cfg file is the cached platform configuration in support of the 
multiple launch points (ie. is the "logical" definition of the install tree 
(which directories, what mix of features/ plugins)). 

So in the general case, this file can exist anywhere and need not be inside the 
install/ directory (so the paths need to be absolute). However, I agree that in 
the simple default case (which is what we are using right now) this introduces 
a legitimate problem.

Transfering the defect to Update component. Will look at fixing the default 
case.

Fixed in split stream by using platform:/base/ URL instead of file: URL for the 
default configuration. This makes it relative to BootLoader that is running.

Will release into HEAD after additional testing (is part of a larger wad of 
changes)
